origin.origDate: No internal date. Before 1855, as it is part of Ariel’s bequest made in that year to the Société Asiatique, Paris (Rosny 1869).

body.p: The Kantapurāṇam is one of the major Tamil texts about the god Skanda/Murukaṉ. It is the work of Kacciyappa Civācāriyār (14th century?).
Other manuscript testimonies of this text are: Bnf Indien 324–327 and 329. See also BnF indien 336–338.
The palm-leaf bundle, a single-text manuscript, contains, between the two woodcovers:
U2: 1 folio, unfoliated = title, chapter header, benediction, invocatory stanza.
U3: 164 folios, Tamil foliation 1‒164 = text (mūlam), up to Makēntirakāṇṭam, Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam.
U4: 1 folio, unfoliated = text (mūlam), beginning of Makēntirakāṇṭam, Vīravāku Kantamātaṉañ Cel Paṭalam.

The text is incomplete. The manuscript contains: Pāyiram, Uṟpattikkāṇṭam, Acurakāṇṭam (up to Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam, verse 66, itself incomplete) in U3; Makēntirakāṇṭam, Viravāku Kantamātaṉañ Cel Paṭalam (up to verse 8, itself incomplete) in U4. Note that the Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam is not named as such in the manuscript, but is divided into 3 chapters: Kupēraceyap Paṭalam (U3, f161r, lm), Akkiṉiceyap Paṭalam (U3, f163r, lm), Yamaṉ Ceyap Paṭalam (U3, f164r, lm).

U2, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = invocation: marginal title, chapter header, and benediction; invocatory stanza.
(f[1]r, lm, 1) kāntappurāṇam [i.e. kantappurāṇam]
(f[1]r, lm, 2) mutal kaṭavuḷ vaṇakkam
(f[1]r, lm, 3) kaṭavuḷ vāḻttup paṭalam
(f[1]r1) tikaṭa cakkarac cemmuka maintuḷāṉ ‡
(f[1]r2) cakaṭa cakkarat tāmarai nāyaka {line-filler} ‡
(f[1]r3) ṉakaṭa cakkara viṉmaṇi yāvuṟai {line-filler} ‡
(f[1]r4) vikaṭa cakkaraṉ meyppatam pōṟṟuvām {pcl}

U3, folio 1, recto = incipit: marginal chapter header; Pāyiram, stanza n° 1 (Vināyakar Kāppu), here included in the Uṟpatti-kāṇṭam.
(f1r, lm) Uṟpattiy(ar)kāṇṭam
(f1r1) tikaṭa cakkarac cemmuka maintuḷāṉ ‡ cakaṭa cakkarat tāmarai nāyaka ‡ ṉakaṭa cakkara viṉmaṇi yāvuṟai ‡ vikaṭa cakkaraṉ meyppatam pōṟṟuvām – 1 – (...)

U3, folio 164, verso = excipit: Makēntirakāṇṭam, Yamaṉ Ceyap Paṭalam, that is, Tikkuvicayap Paṭalam, stanza n° 8; completion statement; total verses; beginning of stanza n° 9.
(f164v9) (…) mēṟṟicai nirutimēl viraivi-
(f164v10) ṉ ēkiṉāṉ – 8 – yamaṉ ceyappaṭalamuṟṟum – Āka ceyyuḷ – 855 – nirutiyum iḵtelām nēṭi yāmivaṟp ‡ poruvatum ariyatāṟ pōri yaṟṟiṉum ‡ varutiṟa- [the manuscript stop abruptly here at the very end of the page]

U4, folio 1, recto, unfoliated = incipit: marginal chapter header; Makēntirakāṇṭam, Vīravāku Kantamātaṉañ Cel Paṭalam, stanza n° 1.
(f[1]r, lm, 1–2) makentira-kāṇṭam
(f[1]r, lm, 3–5) viravāku kantamātaṉañ cer paṭalam
(f[1]r1) Intira ṉāti yāṉa vamararum eṉai yōrum ‡ (...)

U4, folio 1, verso, unfoliated = excipit: Makēntirakāṇṭam, Vīravāku Kantamātaṉañ Cel Paṭalam, stanza n° 7 and beginning of stanza n° 8.
(f[1]v1) koḷ curaṉ ṟaṉpāl vīramā mayēnti rattuc ‡ ceṉṟiṭa viṭuttum yāraic cepputi eṉṉa lōṭu ‡ naṉṟeṉa vataṉai nāṭi nāṉmuka ṉavila luṟṟāṉ [i.e. naviṟa luṟṟāṉ] – 7 – melleṉa vulavai-
(f[1]v2) k kōṉu [the manuscript stop abruptly here at the beginning of line 2]

Abbreviations. c = column, f = folio, lm = left margin, r = recto, rm = right margin, U = unit (codicological and/or textual), v = verso. GOML = Government Oriental Manuscripts Library, Madras/Chennai. MTL = Madras Tamil Lexicon. TMSSML = Tanjore Maharaja Serfoji Sarasvati Mahal Library.

Unmarked puḷḷi, ō, and ē restored. Conjectural (whether the text is not clearly legible or the character is ambigous, e.g. kāl or length of o and e) readings between parentheses. Alternative readings between parentheses separated by slash. Lost or entirely illegible character: "?". Crossed-out character: "X". Conjectural restoration of lost or entirely illegible between square brackets. Uppercase for initial vowels (in excerpts only). Unquoted text represented by (...). Conjunct letter: e.g. t°, to be read tum or tam. Grantha letters in bold. Symbols/Abbreviations made explicit, between curly brackets: {pcs} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, short form; {pcl} = piḷḷaiyār cuḻi, long form, that is, with long horizontal stroke towards right; {varuṣam}, {mācam}, {tēti}; {line-filler}. Unfoliated folio number between square brackets, e.g. "f[1]r". Numerals normalised to decimal notation, e.g. "1121" not "1000 1 100 2 10 1". Hyphen occasionaly used to mark in-word components. Hyphen systematically used at the end of a line when the line-beginning is within a word or within a cīr. Sandhi split to the minimum: overshort u occasionally restored as an apostrophe. Stanzas split by cīr, as far as possible. aṭi boundary marked by "‡".
